raw_text: (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) aim at pos tagging a target language corpus using Englishpos tags as well as estimation of lexical priors (i.e. what pos tags can a word have with what probability) and a tag sequence model
clean_text: (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) aim at pos tagging a target language corpus using English pos tags as well as estimation of lexical priors.

raw_text: Having said this, we follow in principle the algorithm proposed by (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) to estimate lexical priors
clean_text: Having said this, we follow in principle the algorithm proposed by (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) to estimate lexical priors.

raw_text: However, as was noted by (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), most words tend to have at most two pos
clean_text: However, as was noted by (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), most words tend to have at most two pos.

raw_text: A possible explanation is that most of the French words that are picked as likely translations are highly ranked and correspond to the given English word with similar probabilities. (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) propose the same algorithm as the one proposed here for their estimation of lexical priors, with the exception that they use automatic word alignments rather than our extraction algorithm for finding corresponding words
clean_text: (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) propose the same algorithm as the one proposed here for their estimation of lexical priors, with the exception that they use automatic word alignments rather than our extraction algorithm for finding corresponding words.

raw_text: As for (YarowskyandNgai, 2001) estimating lexical priors is merely an inter mediate step, they do not report evaluation results for this step
clean_text: As for (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) estimating lexical priors is merely an intermediate step, they do not report evaluation results for this step.

citing_paper_authors: Longhua, Qian | Haotian, Hui | Ya'nan, Hu | Guodong, Zhou | Qiaoming, Zhu
raw_text: Moreover, the success of joint bilingual learning may lend itself to many inherent multilingual NLP tasks such as POS tagging (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), name entity recognition (Yarowsky et al, 2001), sentiment analysis (Wan, 2009), and semantic role labeling (Sebastian and Lapata, 2009) etc. This paper proposes a bilingual active learning (BAL) paradigm to relation classification with a small number of labeled relation instances and a large number of unlabeled instances in two languages (non-parallel)
clean_text: Moreover, the success of joint bilingual learning may lend itself to many inherent multilingual NLP tasks such as POS tagging (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), name entity recognition (Yarowsky et al, 2001).

raw_text: Our work is closest to that of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001), but differs in two important ways
clean_text: Our work is closest to that of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001), but differs in two important ways.

raw_text: This can be seen as a rough approximation of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001)
clean_text: This can be seen as a rough approximation of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001).

citing_paper_authors: Seokhwan, Kim | Minwoo, Jeong | Jonghoon, Lee | Gary Geunbae, Lee
raw_text: Early studies of cross-lingual annotation projection were accomplished for lexically-based tasks; for example part-of-speech tagging (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), named-entity tagging (Yarowsky et al, 2001), and verb classification (Merlo et al, 2002) .Recently, there has been increasing interest in applications of annotation projection such as dependency parsing (Hwa et al, 2005), mention detection (Zitouni and Florian, 2008), and semantic role labeling (Pado and Lapata, 2009)
clean_text: Early studies of cross-lingual annotation projection were accomplished for lexically-based tasks; for example part-of-speech tagging (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001).

raw_text: The first to explore the idea were Yarowsky and Ngai (2001), who induced a part-of-speech tagger for French and base noun phrase detectors for French and Chinese via transfer from English resources
clean_text: The first to explore the idea were Yarowsky and Ngai (2001), who induced a part-of-speech tagger for French and base noun phrase detectors for French and Chinese via transfer from English resources.

raw_text: Yarowsky and Ngai (2001) were the first to propose the use of parallel texts to bootstrap the creation of taggers
clean_text: Yarowsky and Ngai (2001) were the first to propose the use of parallel texts to bootstrap the creation of taggers.

raw_text: A near exhaustive list is Chew et al (2006), Melamed (1998), Resnik et al (1999), and Yarowsky et al (2001) .Yarowsky and Ngai (2001) is of central relevance to this study

raw_text: can be easily enriched through alignment and projection (e.g., (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001), (Hwa et al, 2002))

Given that we have a parallel corpus where the German side overtly realizes T and V, this is a classical case of annotation projection (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001): We transfer the German T/V information onto the English side to create an annotated English corpus
clean_text: Given that we have a parallel corpus where the German side overtly realizes T and V, this is a classical case of annotation projection (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001).

raw_text: A technique known as annotation projection (YarowskyandNgai, 2001) provides a means to relax this resource bottleneck to some extent: In a word aligned parallel corpus, the text of one language (source language, SL), say English, is annotated with an existing parser, and the word alignments are then used to transfer (or project) the resulting annotations to the other language (target language, TL)
clean_text: A technique known as annotation projection (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) provides a means to relax this resource bottleneck to some extent.

raw_text: Previous research on resource projection attempts to address these problems by redistributing the parameter values (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) or by applying transformation rules (Hwa et al, 851 2002)
clean_text: Previous research on resource projection attempts to address these problems by redistributing the parameter values (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001) or by applying transformation rules (Hwa et al, 851 2002).

raw_text: Following the work of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001) we focus on the task of training a Part-of-Speech (POS) tagger, but we conduct our experiments with the more dissimilar language pair of English Chinese instead of English-French
clean_text: Following the work of Yarowsky and Ngai (2001) we focus on the task of training a Part-of-Speech (POS) tagger, but we conduct our experiments with the more dissimilar language pair of English Chinese instead of English-French.

raw_text: One method of acquiring a large corpus of automatically POS tagged Chinese data is by projection (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001)
clean_text: One method of acquiring a large corpus of automatically POS tagged Chinese data is by projection (Yarowsky and Ngai, 2001).

raw_text: Fol lowing Yarowsky and Ngai (2001), we define 12equivalence classes over the 47 Penn-English Treebank POS tags
